text: The dory snapper, Lutjanus fulviflamma, also known as blackspot snapper, is a species of snapper native to the Indian Ocean and into the Pacific Ocean as far east as Samoa. They inhabit waters over rocky substrates at depths from . The maximum length is . The fish can be seen moving in large aggregations with other Lutjanus species such as Lutjanus kasmira, and Lutjanus lutjanus. == References == == External links == * Reproductive biology of Dory snapper * Itis.org * Animaldiversity Web * WoRMS * Category:Lutjanidae Category:Fish described in 1775
title: Lutjanus fulviflamma
